title: 'Need For Speed' Coming Out On November 3 With 51 Racing Legends That Can Be Extensively Customised
text:
'Need For Speed' Coming Out On November 3 With 51 Racing Legends That Can Be Extensively Customised 0 By Aarati Shah   7:19 am 
Ghost Games, the developers of "Need for Speed," has now announced the full car list for its new "Need for Speed" racing game, all of which can be customized extensively. This announcement comes just a few weeks ahead of the game's November release. Moreover, Ghost Games has also announced that it will be giving "free content updates" all throughout the game's continued run. needforspeed.com Need For Speed 
Ghost Games claims that this is a "full reboot" of the game as "Need for Speed" did not have a 2014 release after being released every year since its launch almost a decade ago. 
There are a total of 51 cars coming from popular car manufacturers like BMW, Chevrolet, Ferrari, Dodge and other makers of legendary street racing cars. Although the list now seems shorter than for other games like Forza Motorsport 6 and Gran Turismo, the cars have been hand-picked for efficiency under high speeding conditions. 
Here's the list of available cars that will be unlocked from the start and 'gated only by in-game prices': one Acura RSX-S, five BMWs, two Chevrolets, two Dodges, two Ferraris, five Ford Mustangs, two Hondas, three Lamborghinis, a Lotus Exige S, three Mazdas, a McLaren 570S, a Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution MR, a cool total of 7 Nissans, four Porsches, a Scion FR-S, two Subarus, three Toyotas, a Volkswagen Golf GTI and Volvo 242. 
All these cars can be customized extensively. Ghost Games has made it clear that the future content updates are free as "Need for Speed won't have paid DLC or microtransactions." 
To improve the game, the game developers, Ghost Games, have asked fans through their 'Closed Beta' for feedbacks and suggestions. One thing that will excite fans is that a new feature has been added to the Wrap Editor. 
Ghost Games, on their official website reported, "We recently sent out a survey to each and every participant of the Closed Beta so if you've already completed it, thank you! If you haven't had time yet, please do take five minutes to fill it out and let us know your thoughts." 
"'Please can I mirror a design in the Wrap Editor' you asked, and a lot of you asked this! We're pleased to confirm that this indeed a feature that's coming to the Wrap Editor in a future content update." 
"Need for Speed" will be out on November 3 for PlayStation 4 and Xbox One.The PC edition is coming in 2016.
